name: Pondicherry & Chennai
metaTitle: Pondicherry & Chennai Tour Package | Beaches, Temples & Culture
metaDescription: Discover Pondicherry & Chennai with VisionFly Holidays. Explore French Quarter, Auroville, Marina Beach, Kapaleeshwarar Temple & more on a 4-day trip.
description: Embark on a captivating journey through the spiritual and cultural hubs of South India! Experience the enchanting charm of Pondicherry with a 2-night stay, where you'll explore the picturesque French Quarter, the philosophical haven of Auroville, and unwind on its serene beaches.

Then, head to Chennai, India's vibrant southern metropolis, for a 1-night stay, where you'll discover its rich cultural heritage, stroll along the iconic Marina Beach, and uncover historic landmarks like Fort St. George, immersing yourself in the city's unique blend of tradition and modernity.

additionalInfo.name: Geography and Climate
additionalInfo.description: Pondicherry and Chennai, located on the Coromandel Coast of the Bay of Bengal in southern India, share a similar geography and climate. Both experience a tropical climate with high temperatures and humidity, featuring distinct wet and dry seasons, with significant rainfall during the northeast monsoon.

itinerary.description: After breakfast, drive to Chennai and check-in to your hotel. Spend the afternoon exploring the city's highlights on a half-day sightseeing tour, visiting Kapaleeshwarar Temple, Government Museum, and Marina Beach. Enjoy some leisure time for shopping.

metaTitle: Goa Getaway Package | Beaches, Nightlife & Heritage
metaDescription: Discover Goa with VisionFly Holidays. Explore beaches, vibrant nightlife, Portuguese heritage, water sports & wellness on a 5-day tropical getaway.
description: Goa, a tropical paradise on India's west coast, is renowned for its stunning beaches, vibrant nightlife, and rich cultural heritage. This 4-night, 5-day getaway offers the perfect opportunity to unwind on pristine shores, explore historic sites like the Basilica of Bom Jesus and Fort Aguada, and experience the local cuisine, a unique blend of Indian and Portuguese flavors.

Enjoy water sports, yoga, and wellness activities, or simply soak up the laid-back atmosphere in this sun-kissed haven. From lively beach parties to serene sunsets, Goa promises an unforgettable experience.

Its 131 km coastline features pristine beaches, estuaries, and mangrove forests. The climate is tropical, with warm temperatures and high humidity year-round, making it ideal for beachgoers and nature lovers.

metaDescription: Explore Himachal with our 6N/7D package covering Shimla, Manali, Solang Valley & Rohtang (subject to permit). Nature, adventure & culture.
description: Located in the majestic Himalayas, Manali and Shimla offer picturesque hill station experiences surrounded by snow-capped mountains, lush forests, and the tranquil Beas River. This 6N/7D Himachal package combines Shimla, Manali and Chandigarh for nature lovers and adventure seekers alike.

Enjoy scenic drives, heritage sightseeing, valley excursions, and optional high-altitude visits (Rohtang subject to permit). Experience local culture, markets, and serene mountain panoramas across this curated itinerary.

additionalInfo.name: Geography and Climate
additionalInfo.description: Manali has a subtropical highland climate with four distinct seasons. Winters are cold and snowy, with temperatures ranging from -2°C to 10°C. Summers are mild and pleasant, with temperatures ranging from 15°C to 25°C. Spring and autumn are characterized by mild temperatures and scenic beauty, with temperatures ranging from 10°C to 20°C.

itinerary.description: After breakfast excursion to Kufri for Himalayan panoramas, pony and yak rides. Post-lunch explore Shimla highlights including Christ Church, Vice Regal Lodge, The Mall, Scandal Point and local markets.

itinerary.title: Shimla to Manali

itinerary.title: Manali Local Sightseeing

metaTitle: Best Rajasthan Tour Package | Jaipur, Udaipur & Pushkar
metaDescription: Explore Rajasthan with VisionFly Holidays. Visit Jaipur, Ajmer, Pushkar & Udaipur. Forts, palaces, lakes, cultural experiences & authentic cuisine.
description: Experience the enchanting land of Rajasthan, where majestic forts and palaces whisper tales of the past. Explore Jaipur, Pushkar, Ajmer, and Udaipur while enjoying Rajasthan’s vibrant markets, golden dunes, serene lakes, and royal hospitality.

This journey blends history, culture, and unforgettable landscapes — from the bustling bazaars to tranquil lakes and iconic heritage monuments. Perfect for travelers seeking a taste of royalty and rustic charm.

additionalInfo.name: Geography and Climate
additionalInfo.description: Rajasthan, India’s largest state, covers approx. 342,239 sq. km and is bordered by Pakistan, Gujarat, Madhya Pradesh, Uttar Pradesh, Haryana and Punjab. The Aravalli Range divides the desert west from the fertile east. The climate is largely arid with very hot summers, cold winters and monsoon rains July–September.

itinerary.title: Jaipur – Ajmer / Pushkar
itinerary.description: After breakfast drive to Ajmer. Visit Ajmer Sharif Dargah, Adhai-Din-Ka Jhonpra, Ana Sagar Lake. Continue to Pushkar to visit temples, ghats and Pushkar Lake including the Brahma Temple. Overnight stay at Ajmer/Pushkar.

itinerary.title: Ajmer / Pushkar – Udaipur via Nathdwara & Eklingji
itinerary.description: Drive to Udaipur with en-route visits to Nathdwara and Eklingji temples. On arrival check-in at hotel. Evening optional boat ride on Lake Pichola to view City Palace and sunset (at own cost). Overnight stay at Udaipur.

itinerary.description: After breakfast check out from hotel and transfer to Udaipur Railway Station / Airport for onward journey.

A blend of natural beauty, Tibetan and Indian influences, and warm hospitality makes this tour unforgettable.

name: kashmir delight
metaTitle: Kashmir Delight Tour Package | Srinagar, Gulmarg & Pahalgam Trip
metaDescription: Experience Kashmir’s beauty with VisionFly Holidays. Visit Srinagar, Gulmarg, Pahalgam & Sonmarg. Lakes, mountains, gardens & houseboat stay await you.
description: Tucked away in the majestic Himalayas, Kashmir is a land of breathtaking beauty, rich culture, and warm hospitality. Dubbed the Paradise on Earth, Kashmir is a treasure trove of natural wonders, from serene lakes and snow-capped mountains to lush green valleys and picturesque villages. The region's stunning landscapes, diverse wildlife, and vibrant cultural heritage make it a destination like no other. With its majestic mountains, pristine lakes, and rolling hills

Kashmir is a nature lover's paradise. The region's diverse geography supports a wide range of flora and fauna, including some rare and endangered species. From the snow-capped peaks of Gulmarg and Sonmarg to the tranquil waters of Dal Lake and Manasbal Lake, Kashmir's natural beauty is simply breathtaking.

additionalInfo.name: Geography and Climate
additionalInfo.description: Kashmir has a humid subtropical climate with four distinct seasons. Winters are cold and snowy, with temperatures ranging from -2°C to 10°C. Summers are mild and pleasant, with temperatures ranging from 15°C to 30°C. Spring and autumn are characterized by mild temperatures and scenic beauty, with temperatures ranging from 10°C to 20°C.

itinerary.title: Arrival in Srinagar
itinerary.description: Upon arrival, meet our representative and take a transfer to the hotel. Spend the day at leisure on boulevard road which is one of the most famous roads in Srinagar for tourists and is situated around the Dal Lake surrounded by Zabarwan mountain ranges, also enjoy a 1 hr shikara ride in Dal Lake at Nehru Park on boulevard road.

itinerary.title: Srinagar – Sonmarg - Srinagar (85 kms / 2:30 hours approximately)
itinerary.description: After breakfast leave for Sonmarg “The meadow of gold. Situated at an altitude of 9000 Ft. Sonmarg is at a distance of 84 Kms from Srinagar is also called as “The meadow of gold”,Sonmarg lies in Sindh Valley streamed with flowers and surrounded by mountains. The place is also the base for some interesting treks to the high altitude of Himalayan Lake. Ponies can be hired for the trip up to Thajiwas glacier, which is a major local attraction during the summer.

itinerary.title: Srinagar – Gulmarg (60 kms / 2:00 hours approximately)
itinerary.description: After breakfast drive to Gulmarg 'Meadow of Flowers' at 2730 Mts. above sea level. Gulmarg has one of the best ski slopes in the world and the highest golf course of the world with 18 holes. One can also have the view of Nanga Parbhat if weather permits. The view enroute from Tangmarg to Gulmarg is fascinating. In Gulmarg, one can also have a short trek upto Khilangmarg which can be covered in about 3 to 4 hours or enjoy the scenic view of Kongdori on a Cable Car known as Gondola (on your own).

itinerary.title: Gulmarg – Pahalgam (140 kms / 3:30 hours approximately)
itinerary.description: After breakfast drive to Pahalgam 'Valley of Shepherds'. On arrival check in at hotel. In Pahalgam enjoy the nature and admire the beauty of this quiet place with serene surroundings. One can also enjoy a pony ride to nearby places like Chandanwadi (on a direct hire basis) or take a peaceful walk along the River Lidder. Pahalgam is also famous for trekking routes and is the base camp for the Amarnath Pilgrimage.

itinerary.title: Pahalgam – Srinagar Local Sightseeing
itinerary.description: After breakfast, drive to Srinagar and enjoy sightseeing of the famous Mughal Gardens: Cheshma Shahi 'Royal Spring', Shalimar 'Garden of Love', Nishat Garden 'Garden of Pleasure', and Shankaracharya Temple. On return, visit a local Handicrafts Showroom for hand-knotted specialty silken carpets, shawls, and jewelry ornaments.

itinerary.title: Srinagar – Onward Destination
itinerary.description: After breakfast get ready for transfer to Srinagar airport to board your scheduled flight for onward destination.

name: Chardham Pilgrimage Tour
metaTitle: Chardham Yatra | Yamunotri, Gangotri, Kedarnath, Badrinath
metaDescription: Embark on the sacred Chardham Yatra in Uttarakhand, visiting Yamunotri, Gangotri, Kedarnath, and Badrinath, and experience spiritual bliss in the Himalayas.
description: The Char Dham Yatra is a revered pilgrimage to four sacred shrines in India: Yamunotri, Gangotri, Kedarnath, and Badrinath.
Experience spiritual cleansing, divine blessings, and the majestic beauty of Uttarakhand's Himalayas.
The pilgrimage combines devotion, trekking, and exploration of sacred rivers, temples, and natural landscapes.

additionalInfo.name: Geography and Climate
additionalInfo.description:
The Char Dham Yatra is situated in the majestic Himalayan mountain range of Uttarakhand, India. The region's geography is characterized by snow-capped peaks, lush valleys, and sacred rivers, including the Ganga and Yamuna. The climate varies with the seasons, with pleasant weather during the pilgrimage season (April/May to October/November), while winters are harsh and snowy, and summers can be mild to warm in the lower regions. The region's diverse geography and climate support a rich variety of flora and fauna, adding to the natural beauty and spiritual significance of the Char Dham Yatra. 

The pilgrimage is also a profound spiritual journey, representing an act of devotion, surrender, and quest for divine blessings. By undertaking the Char Dham Yatra, devotees seek to purify the soul, remove negative karma, and attain spiritual merit, connecting deeply with the sacred energy of these revered sites.

itinerary.title: Haridwar to Barkot
itinerary.description: Drive from Haridwar to Barkot via Dehradun and Mussoorie. Visit Kempty Falls en route. Check-in to hotel and overnight stay in Barkot.

itinerary.title: Yamunotri Pilgrimage
itinerary.description: Drive to Jankichatti/Phoolchatti and trek to Yamunotri (on foot, pony, or Doli). Take a holy bath in Jamunabai Kund, offer prayers at Yamunotri Temple, and return to Barkot. Overnight stay.

itinerary.title: Barkot to Uttarkashi
itinerary.description: Drive to Uttarkashi, check-in, and visit Kashi Vishwanath Temple and other local shrines. Overnight stay in Uttarkashi.

itinerary.title: Gangotri Pilgrimage
itinerary.description: Drive to Gangotri via Harsil Valley. Take a dip in Bhagirathi River, visit Gangotri Temple, and return to Uttarkashi for overnight stay.

itinerary.title: Uttarkashi to Guptkashi/Sitapur
itinerary.description: Scenic drive from Uttarkashi to Guptkashi/Sitapur via Moolgarh and Lambgaon. Visit Ardh Narishwar Temple. Overnight stay in Guptkashi.

itinerary.title: Guptkashi to Kedarnath
itinerary.description: Drive to Gaurikund and trek 19 km to Kedarnath (on foot, pony, or Doli). Visit Kedarnath Temple and Adi Shankaracharya Samadhi. Overnight stay in Kedarnath.

itinerary.title: Kedarnath to Guptkashi/Sitapur
itinerary.description: Trek back to Gaurikund and drive to Guptkashi/Sitapur. Optional visit to Triyugi Narayan Temple. Overnight stay.

itinerary.title: Guptkashi to Badrinath
itinerary.description: Drive to Badrinath, take holy bath in Taptkund, visit Badrinath Temple and nearby attractions such as Brahma Kapal, Mana Village, Vyas Gufa, Mata Murti Temple, Bhimkund, and Charanpaduka. Overnight stay.

itinerary.title: Badrinath to Rudraprayag
itinerary.description: Drive via Pipalkoti and Joshimath, visit Narsingh Temple, and reach Rudraprayag. Check-in and overnight stay.

itinerary.title: Return to Haridwar
itinerary.description: Drive back to Haridwar via Laxman Jhula and Ram Jhula. Drop at hotel or railway station, marking the end of the pilgrimage.

itinerary.title: Arrival and Exploration

itinerary.title: Havelock – Elephanta Beach
itinerary.description: Day trip to Elephanta Beach for water sports, coral reef exploration, and relaxation. Overnight stay at Havelock.

description: Gangtok, the capital city of Sikkim, is a breathtakingly beautiful destination that offers a unique blend of tradition and modernity. Visit the iconic Rumtek Monastery, a sacred site for Buddhists, and explore the bustling streets of MG Road, lined with shops, restaurants, and cafes.

Lachung, a picturesque hill station, is a hidden gem nestled in the lap of the Himalayas. Located at an altitude of 2,600 meters, Lachung is a tranquil retreat that offers breathtaking views of the surrounding mountains and valleys. Visit the stunning Lachung Monastery, explore the picturesque villages, and marvel at the majestic waterfalls that cascade down the hills.

Lachen, another charming hill town, is a serene and peaceful destination that offers a glimpse into traditional Sikkimese culture. Located at an altitude of 2,750 meters, Lachen is a haven for nature lovers and adventure seekers. Visit the sacred Lachen Monastery, explore the picturesque villages, and marvel at the breathtaking views of the surrounding mountains and valleys.

additionalInfo.name: Geography and Climate
additionalInfo.description: Rajasthan is the largest state in India, covering an area of approximately 342,239 square kilometers. It is located in the northwestern part of the country, bordered by Pakistan to the west, Gujarat to the southwest, Madhya Pradesh to the southeast, Uttar Pradesh and Haryana to the northeast, and Punjab to the north. The state has a varied geography, with the Aravalli Range running across the state from southwest to northeast. The range divides the state into two distinct regions: the desert region to the west and the more fertile region to the east.

additionalInfo.name: Climate
additionalInfo.description: Rajasthan has a dry desert climate, with very little rainfall throughout the year. The state experiences extreme temperatures, with very hot summers and cold winters. Summer (April to June): Temperatures can soar up to 48°C (118°F). Winter (October to February): Temperatures can drop as low as 0°C (32°F). Monsoon (July to September): Rajasthan receives most of its rainfall during monsoon season, providing relief from the heat. The desert region is the hottest and driest.

name: Shimla
metaTitle: Shimla Tour Package | Scenic Hills, Temples & Colonial Charm
metaDescription: Discover Shimla with VisionFly Holidays. Explore the Mall Road, Jakhoo Temple, Kufri, Christ Church, Ridge Road & more on a refreshing hill getaway.
description: Shimla, the Queen of Hills, is one of India's most iconic hill stations known for its colonial charm, pleasant climate, and scenic Himalayan landscapes. With bustling streets, stunning viewpoints, and a touch of heritage, Shimla offers a refreshing escape from the plains.

Explore popular attractions like Mall Road, Ridge Road, Kufri, Jakhoo Temple, and Christ Church, while soaking in the serene environment and cool mountain breeze that make Shimla a year-round favorite.

additionalInfo.name: Geography and Climate
additionalInfo.description: Shimla, located in Himachal Pradesh at an elevation of around 2,200 meters, features a subtropical highland climate. itinerary.description: After breakfast, check out and drive back to Chandigarh/Delhi for your onward journey.

name: Manali
metaTitle: Manali Tour Package | Himalayan Adventure & Scenic Views
metaDescription: Explore the beautiful hill station of Manali with VisionFly Holidays. Visit Hadimba Temple, Solang Valley, Rohtang Pass, Manu Temple, and enjoy a refreshing Himalayan getaway.
description: Manali, the adventure capital of Himachal Pradesh, is renowned for its snow-capped mountains, lush valleys, and vibrant culture. With its thrilling adventure activities and serene landscapes, Manali promises an unforgettable experience.
Explore popular attractions like Hadimba Temple, Solang Valley, Rohtang Pass, Manu Temple, and enjoy local markets, river views, and scenic drives surrounded by the mighty Himalayas.

additionalInfo.name: Geography and Climate
additionalInfo.description: Manali is located at an altitude of approximately 2,050 meters in Himachal Pradesh. Summers are mild with temperatures ranging from 15°C to 28°C, while winters are cold with snowfall, making it ideal for winter sports and adventure activities.
